definition: to have a connection with/to be close (to reality)/to be relevant/to have one's hand in
to moisten/to be infected by/to receive benefit or advantage through a contact/to touch
suffix of a noun of locality

sentences.english: If you’re studying languages, it doesn’t even come close.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在學習一門語言，還是和它不沾邊。

sentences.english: They're never anything to do with science.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的人從來不談論和科學沾邊兒的事情。

sentences.english: Until then I've been bored by everythellong associated with English courses.
sentences.chinese: 在這以前，我對於所有跟英文課沾邊的事都感應膩味。

sentences.english: This style of development doesn't jive with the concept of shared services.
sentences.chinese: 這種風格的開發與共享服務的概念一點也不沾邊。

sentences.english: Nobody in the company had done anything 3D.
sentences.chinese: 公司裏沒有任何人幹過與3D沾邊的活。

sentences.english: Until then I'd been bored by everything associated with English courses.
sentences.chinese: 在這之前，我對所有跟英文課沾邊的事感到膩味。

sentences.english: I didn’t want to go into the retail business. I hated it.
sentences.chinese: 我壓根就不想跟零售業沾邊，厭惡至極。
